hero.description: 17  years  ago,  Vipin  Pavithran  founded  FOSS@Amrita  as  a  place  for  dedicated minds  to  learn,  work,  and  grow  together. From  its  humble  beginnings,  the  club, now  called  amFOSS,  would  go  on  to  build  a  reputation  of  one  of  the  best student  communities  in  the  country.

mission.title: To create a great engineer
points: Train students in cultivating relevant software development skills, including code comprehension, debugging, and writing standard code.
Equip students with problem-solving skills to collaboratively tackle real-life challenges, enhancing critical thinking, creativity, and communication abilities.
Instill the art of self-directed learning, enabling students to become independent learners.
Facilitate peer interaction and project development, leveraging technology to address societal issues.
Encourage students to break free from conformity, and empower them to dream their own dreams.

mission.title: To foster a good human being
points: Instill an awareness of nature to safeguard its resources.
Embrace an attitude of servitude and discover the joy in giving.
Imbibe a sense of responsibility towards fellow beings.
Build emotional resilience to manage both success and failure.
Promote mental, physical, and emotional health.

items.title: MENTORSHIP
items.description: Every member is assigned multiple mentors, from immediate seniors to experienced faculty and alumni, underscoring the foundational principle of mentor-mentee relationships.

items.title: SELF-SUSTENANCE
items.description: Task forces within the club, handling everything from administration and recruitment to event organisation, means that the self-contained nature of the community is sustained.

footer.title: amFOSS is the collective effort of scores of passionate students, faculty, and advisors.
